question:
Consider the following statements about the Biological and Toxin Weapons Convention (BTWC):
  1. It is the first multilateral disarmament treaty that banned the entire category of weapons of mass destruction (WMD).
  2. India has signed as well as ratified the treaty
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: <u>First statement is correct</u>. Biological and Toxin Weapons Convention (BTWC) was the first multilateral disarmament treaty banning the production of an entire category of weapons. <u>Second statement is also correct</u>. The BWC has 180 States Parties as of now, out of which 109 are signatories and 22 have signed as well as ratified the treaty. The treaty aims to prohibit the development, production, and stockpiling of biological and toxin weapons. India has ratified the Biological and Toxin Weapons Convention (BTWC) in 2015. It came into existence in 1972. The BTWC also has provision for a Review Conference to be held every five years.
